alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 8:44AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall will impact portions of northeastern Gloucester, Middlesex, east central King and Queen, Northumberland, Richmond, southeastern Westmoreland, southeastern Essex and Lancaster Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 843 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and embedded thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall. These showers were along a line extending from Piney Point to near Farnham to Church View. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Warsaw, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Fair Port, Robley, Deltaville, Callao, Lancaster, White Stone, Kinsale, Saluda, Farnham, Jamaica, Dunnsville, Hague, Sharps, Hartfield, Center Cross, Morattico and Heathsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland
